text: , also known as IJN, was the navy of the Empire of Japan from 1869 until 1947.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Kaigun" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 450. The IJN was created in 1868 by the Meiji Restoration. It won against larger navies in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895) and Russo-Japanese War (1904-1905) World War 1 (1914-1918) Second Sino-Japanese War (1937-1945) World War 2 (1941-1945) and was dissolved.Library of Congress Country Studies, Japan (LOC), "World War II and the Occupation, 1941-52". Retrieved 2012-2-22. ==Legacy== Article 9 of the Constitution of Japan prohibits the use of aggressive force as a means for settling international disputes.LOC, "The Article 9 'No War' Clause". Retrieved 2012-2-22. In order to defend Japan, if necessary, the Japan Self-Defense Forces (JSDF) was formed.LOC, "The Self- Defence Forces" (JSDF). Retrieved 2012-2-22. The ocean-reach of JSDF is the Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force (JMSDF).LOC, "Maritime Self-Defense Force" (JMSDF). Retrieved 2012-2-22. ==Related pages== * Imperial Japanese Army ==References == ==Other websites== * AxisHistory.com, Japanese Navy * CombinedFleet.com, Imperial Japanese Navy Page * KamikazeImages, Etajima Museum of Naval History * NavalHistory.net, Imperial Japanese Navy Awards of the Golden Kite in World War II * NavalHistory.net, Imperial Japanese Navy in World War I Category:Military of Japan Category:1869 establishments in Japan Category:1947 disestablishments Category:1940s disestablishments in Japan
title: Imperial Japanese Navy
